context_left: Based on the unique sample count of malware threats seen by the
context_right: Cloud Sandbox, Emotet and its downloaders appear to be among the most prevalent threats in 2019, followed by banking trojans and loaders, such as TrickBot and Ursnif, remote-access trojans (RATs), and off-the-shelf password stealers, such as LokiBot and AZORult.

sentence_left: Now, it is mostly used for spamming and downloading additional malware threats on a target system.
sentence_right: Emotet is modular by design, as it supports multiple modules for different tasks, such as stealing information, spamming, and more.
label: Zscaler ((US English)) is a cloud security company, with headquarters in San Jose, California. It offers a platform for businesses that move their data to the cloud, with employees who work remotely.

context_right: ThreatLabZ team proactively tracks and ensures coverage to block downloaders, payloads, and C&C activity from Emotet and other threats.

sentence_left: Although it started as a banking trojan, Emotet is now associated with several different malware campaigns, including ransomware and infostealers.
